result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dmarion Franklin Beckley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dmarion Franklin Beckley appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas James Flanagan appeared by video for Dmarion Franklin Beckley.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense in need of discovery as wrong defense counsel was added to case at the last hearing. State informs the Court this case may resolve with a DPA. Defense counsel requests a status date to allow defendant time to get a TAD evaluation. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 30.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dmarion Franklin Beckley in court.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Dmarion Franklin Beckley.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Watts. Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Richards, Br. 30.   
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/19/22 @ 1:30p
